newsitem.title: USA: UroHealth restates results, stock drops.
newsitem.headline: UroHealth restates results, stock drops.

text.p: UroHealth Systems Inc., a maker of surgical products, Tuesday revised downward the results of the first three quarters of fiscal 1997, prompting a sharp sell-off of the company's stock.
UroHealth fell almost $1, or more than 16 percent, to $5 on Nasdaq in afternoon trading.
The Newport Beach, Calif.-based company restated its results to show the effects of a deferral of some revenue.

Earnings per share for the third quarter ended Dec. 31, 1996, were restated to 1 cent from an original 15 cents. Its net loss per share for the quarter ended Sept. 30, 1996, was restated to $1.88 from $1.80 and its loss for the quarter ended June 30, 1996, was restated to 22 cents from 16 cents previously.
UroHealth said the deferred revenue is associated with initial stock orders to distributors for products shipped by its surgical division and new video endoscopy products shipped during fiscal 1997.

As a result, the company will defer recognising revenues of $900,000, $1.3 million, $2.7 million and $11.7 million related to net shipments in the first through fourth quarters of fiscal 1997, respectively, it said.
